section.title: Connecting with Azure Active Directory SyncEO_adsync
section.para: To connect your company account with Microsoft's Azure Active Directory Sync and automatically import users, you must first set up Azure AD with the Symantec Security Cloud application.
In AD Sync, you provide the following settings:

listitem.para: Symantec recommends that you use Symantec Security Cloud as the name. The type is Web application and/or web API.
Provide the sign-on URL and the App ID URI. It should be the same as your Symantec Security Cloud URL, https://login.symantec.com/sso/sp/SAML2.
Get the client ID and secret key for the application.
You provide these values in Symantec Security Cloud when you set up AD Sync.
For Application Permissions, set Read directory data.
For Delegated Permissions, set Read directory data and Enable sign-on and read users' profiles.
Get the Federation Metadata Document from the list of App Endpoints. (Go to View Endpoints from the Azure page for your application.

note.para: We recommend that you view the video about setting up this feature.

section.para: When you import users from Azure AD, they are assigned to the default group.

note.para: You must create administrator accounts manually.
